segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: Welcome back to another great lesson here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: And today we've got a great lesson for you at the upper intermediate level.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一堂很棒的中高级课程。

segments.en: We're going to be talking about an interesting topic, which is gambling.
segments.cn: 我们将讨论一个有趣的话题，即赌博。

segments.en: Yeah, I don't know if you like to do this, Marco.
segments.cn: 是的，我不知道你是否喜欢这样做，Marco。

segments.en: Go, you know, play some cards, play some poker, Blackjack, throw the dice.
segments.cn: 去玩牌、玩扑克、二十一点、掷骰子。

segments.en: I'm actually a bit of a fan of the roulette.
segments.cn: 我其实有点喜欢轮盘赌。

segments.en: You have to throw the ball onto the wheel that's spinning and lands into, like, a little compartment in a number.
segments.cn: 你必须把球扔到旋转的轮子上，球会落到一个数字的小隔间里。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So you can win, like, based on the number and the color.
segments.cn: 所以你可以根据数字和颜色来赢。

segments.en: But it's interesting because if you get the number right, it pays you 35 times your bet.
segments.cn: 但有趣的是，如果你猜对了数字，奖金是你下注的35倍。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: That's a lot of money to win.
segments.cn: 这可是一笔不少的钱。

segments.en: A lot of potential there, but there's a lot of numbers on that wheel.
segments.cn: 这里有很大的潜力，但轮子上的数字很多。

segments.en: But that's the thing.
segments.cn: 但这就是问题所在。

segments.en: Some people like gambling, some people don't like it.
segments.cn: 有些人喜欢赌博，有些人不喜欢。

segments.en: And in some countries, in some states, it's illegal, right?
segments.cn: 在一些国家和州，赌博是非法的，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So today we're talking about a city that's looking to legalize this sport.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们要谈论一个希望合法化这种运动的城市。

segments.en: So we're going to take a listen.
segments.cn: 我们将来听听。

segments.en: Here at one time, we come back, we're talking all about what's going on in today's lesson.
segments.cn: 一会儿回来，我们将讨论今天课程的所有内容。

segments.en: Did you hear?
segments.cn: 你听说了吗？

segments.en: The state is thinking of legalizing gambling in our city.
segments.cn: 该州正在考虑在我们的城市合法化赌博。

segments.en: Soon we're going to have amazing hotels and casinos here, which would be good for business.
segments.cn: 不久我们将有很棒的酒店和赌场，这对商业有好处。

segments.en: Are you serious?
segments.cn: 你是认真的吗？

segments.en: Gambling is a vice industry built on deception and fed by the intentional exploitation of human weakness for the sole purpose of monetary gain.
segments.cn: 赌博是一个建立在欺骗基础上的恶习产业，利用人类的弱点以获取金钱。

segments.en: It disgusts me.
segments.cn: 这让我感到恶心。

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: How does it exploit people?
segments.cn: 它是如何剥削人们的？

segments.en: Well, to begin with, gambling is addictive.
segments.cn: 首先，赌博是上瘾的。

segments.en: It ruins marriages, destroys families and bankrupts communities.
segments.cn: 它毁掉婚姻，摧毁家庭，使社区破产。

segments.en: Once you're addicted, it's very difficult to stop.
segments.cn: 一旦上瘾，很难停止。

segments.en: People have lost their houses, cars, and have been left out on the street after becoming addicted.
segments.cn: 人们失去了房子、汽车，成瘾后被抛弃在街头。

segments.en: Secondly, it exploits because men become addicted to gambling most often because of the action and risk.
segments.cn: 其次，赌博的剥削在于，男性往往因行动和风险而上瘾。

segments.en: Women gamble to escape, and senior citizens will start gambling for social interaction.
segments.cn: 女性赌博是为了逃避，而老年人则是为了社交而开始赌博。

segments.en: Underage gamblers often start gambling on sports with friends and then illegal bookies.
segments.cn: 未成年人往往是和朋友一起在体育上开始赌博，然后找非法的庄家。

segments.en: Geez.
segments.cn: 天哪。

segments.en: Now that I think about it, maybe legalizing gambling isn't such a good idea.
segments.cn: 现在想想，也许合法化赌博并不是个好主意。

segments.en: Although, I have been to Las Vegas, and I didn't become addicted or anything like that.
segments.cn: 不过，我去过拉斯维加斯，我没有上瘾或其他什么。

segments.en: You cannot predict who will become addicted to gambling.
segments.cn: 你无法预测谁会对赌博上瘾。

segments.en: Now, excuse me.
segments.cn: 现在，打扰一下。

segments.en: I have a protest rally to organize.
segments.cn: 我有一个抗议集会要组织。

segments.en: Alright, so very strong opinions against gambling, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以对赌博有很强的反对意见，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: So we've got someone who hasn't really thought it through, and another person who has thought way too much about what's going on.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一个没有认真思考的人，还有一个思考过多的人。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And well, he did point out some very interesting arguments against gambling.
segments.cn: 而且，他确实指出了一些非常有趣的反对赌博的论点。

segments.en: And so we're going to take a look at some of the language that person used today in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们将看看那个人在语言收获中使用的一些语言。

segments.en: Well, this first word we've got here is a word that has to do with the topic of today's lesson.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们这里的第一个词与今天课程的话题有关。

segments.en: So, legalizing gambling.
segments.cn: 所以，合法化赌博。

segments.en: What does it mean to legalize?
segments.cn: 合法化是什么意思？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, to legalize.
segments.cn: 所以，合法化。

segments.en: To make it legal.
segments.cn: 使其合法。

segments.en: So, legal is the word that refers to law.
segments.cn: 所以，合法是指法律的词。

segments.en: And so that means to make something okay.
segments.cn: 这意味着使某事变得可以。

segments.en: It means to allow something in a state or a country.
segments.cn: 这意味着在一个州或国家允许某事。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, in many countries, it's illegal to gamble.
segments.cn: 所以，在许多国家，赌博是非法的。

segments.en: So, in this case, the city is looking to legalize it to make it legal.
segments.cn: 所以，在这种情况下，城市希望合法化它，使其合法。

segments.en: Alright, so many young people in America would like to see this law changed.
segments.cn: 好吧，美国许多年轻人希望看到这项法律改变。

segments.en: You're not allowed to drink until you're 21 years old.
segments.cn: 你必须等到21岁才能喝酒。

segments.en: Drink alcohol, that is.
segments.cn: 喝酒，当然。

segments.en: So, they would like to see the legalization of underage drinking.
segments.cn: 所以，他们希望看到未成年人饮酒的合法化。

segments.en: Now, is it 21 in all states or in the majority?
segments.cn: 现在，所有州都是21岁还是大多数州？

segments.en: Yes, all states.
segments.cn: 是的，所有州。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: I thought it was only in some of them.
segments.cn: 我以为只有一些州。

segments.en: No, it changed in the late 70s, I think.
segments.cn: 不，70年代末的时候改变了，我想。

segments.en: But you absolutely cannot drink until you're 21.
segments.cn: 但你绝对不能在21岁之前喝酒。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: What do you think?
segments.cn: 你怎么看？

segments.en: Is that okay or is that...?
segments.cn: 这样可以吗，还是...?

segments.en: I think that it encourages young people to drink irresponsibly.
segments.cn: 我认为这鼓励年轻人不负责任地饮酒。

segments.en: And so I believe we should legalize drinking at the age of 18 because it would make people learn how to be more responsible.
segments.cn: 所以我相信我们应该在18岁时合法化饮酒，因为这会让人们学会更负责任。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: Alright, so we want to legalize underage drinking.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们想要合法化未成年人饮酒。

segments.en: English fun.
segments.cn: 英语乐趣。

segments.en: Alright, no, let's not manipulate my words.
segments.cn: 好吧，不要曲解我的话。

segments.en: This next word is very, very important.
segments.cn: 下一个词非常非常重要。

segments.en: He's saying that gambling or the gambling industry exploits people.
segments.cn: 他在说赌博或赌博产业剥削人们。

segments.en: Okay, exploit.
segments.cn: 好吧，剥削。

segments.en: You might have heard this in the news before.
segments.cn: 你可能在新闻中听说过这个。

segments.en: We talk about often in the news the exploitation of people.
segments.cn: 我们经常在新闻中谈论剥削人。

segments.en: But in this case, we're talking about exploiting people through money and gambling.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，我们谈论的是通过金钱和赌博剥削人。

segments.en: Right, so to exploit basically is to take advantage of them, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以剥削基本上是利用他们，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, to use them for something.
segments.cn: 是的，利用他们来获取某种东西。

segments.en: Not to treat them as people, but to use them as a way to get something.
segments.cn: 不是把他们当作人，而是把他们当作获取某种东西的手段。

segments.en: Alright, so we often hear about it, as you say, in news about, you know, factories or companies exploiting their employees or something of the sort.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们经常在新闻中听到，比如工厂或公司剥削员工之类的事情。

segments.en: We can also exploit the earth for its resources by taking oil and taking diamonds and taking gold.
segments.cn: 我们也可以通过提取石油、钻石和黄金来剥削地球的资源。

segments.en: Okay, so to take advantage of.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以是利用。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: So, to exploit is the verb, but exploitation is the noun.
segments.cn: 所以，剥削是动词，但剥削是名词。

segments.en: Alright, that's the thing.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是问题。

segments.en: So we talk about the exploitation of people in this country or the exploitation of the earth.
segments.cn: 所以我们谈论的是这个国家对人们的剥削或对地球的剥削。

segments.en: And they're talking about how gambling exploits people and how it's a vice.
segments.cn: 他们在谈论赌博如何剥削人们，以及它是如何成为一种恶习的。

segments.en: Ooh, vices.
segments.cn: 哦，恶习。

segments.en: So, for those of you Christians out there, you might be very familiar with the sins, right?
segments.cn: 所以，对于在场的基督徒来说，你们可能对罪非常熟悉，对吧？

segments.en: The seven deadly sins.
segments.cn: 七宗罪。

segments.en: Well, these are all vices, things that you do that are bad.
segments.cn: 这些都是恶习，做的坏事。

segments.en: So, drinking too much is a vice.
segments.cn: 所以，喝酒过量是一种恶习。

segments.en: Right, or eating too much, right?
segments.cn: 对，或者吃得太多，对吧？

segments.en: Right, or spending money without having money may be a vice for you.
segments.cn: 对，或者没有钱却花钱可能对你来说是一种恶习。

segments.en: So, addictions are also a type of vice, right?
segments.cn: 所以，上瘾也是一种恶习，对吧？

segments.en: Like drinking, smoking, or drug abuse.
segments.cn: 像喝酒、吸烟或滥用药物。

segments.en: Exactly, these are all vices.
segments.cn: 确切地说，这些都是恶习。

segments.en: So, vice is a bad thing.
segments.cn: 所以，恶习是坏事。

segments.en: Now, we may remember this show, popular American show, called Miami Vice.
segments.cn: 现在，我们可能记得这个节目，一个受欢迎的美国节目，叫《迈阿密风云》。

segments.en: So, what is that?
segments.cn: 那是什么？

segments.en: Ooh, well, Miami Vice, it's in the city of Miami and it's about police officers.
segments.cn: 哦，《迈阿密风云》，它在迈阿密市，讲的是警察的故事。

segments.en: So, in the police, there's sometimes a group called the Vice Squad.
segments.cn: 所以，在警察中，有时会有一个叫做恶习小组的团队。

segments.en: These are people who go out and try and stop people who are doing things that are vices.
segments.cn: 这些人出去试图阻止那些做恶习的人。

segments.en: Oh, like drugs and gambling and stuff like that.
segments.cn: 哦，比如毒品和赌博之类的。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，确切地说。

segments.en: Vice Squad, interesting.
segments.cn: 恶习小组，真有趣。

segments.en: All right, and now for the last word on language takeaway, we have this interesting word, a bookie.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在最后一个关于语言的收获，我们有这个有趣的词，赌徒。

segments.en: All right, so if any of you like to go to the horse races, you might be familiar with this one.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果你们中有人喜欢去赛马，你们可能对这个词很熟悉。

segments.en: A bookie is someone who helps you make a bet.
segments.cn: 赌徒是帮助你下注的人。

segments.en: It's his job to help you make a bet.
segments.cn: 他的工作就是帮助你下注。

segments.en: So, we often see it in movies.
segments.cn: 所以，我们常常在电影中看到它。

segments.en: Maybe you are betting on a sports competition, right?
segments.cn: 也许你在下注一场体育比赛，对吧？

segments.en: And you are betting, I don't know, $10 against this team.
segments.cn: 你在赌，我不知道，10美元对这支队伍。

segments.en: So, you would go to a bookie to place your bet because there's not really any legal place where you can do it.
segments.cn: 所以，你会去找赌徒来下注，因为没有合法的地方可以下注。

segments.en: Exactly, or if I want to say, okay, tonight, the Chicago Bulls are playing the Suns and you want to put $100 on the Chicago Bulls.
segments.cn: 确切地说，或者如果我想说，好吧，今晚，芝加哥公牛队对太阳队，你想在芝加哥公牛队下注100美元。

segments.en: That means they're going to win.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们会赢。

segments.en: So, you use a bookie and he helps you put the money down.
segments.cn: 所以，你用赌徒，他帮助你下注。

segments.en: Now, usually, this is illegal, right?
segments.cn: 现在，通常这都是非法的，对吧？

segments.en: Generally, it's illegal, yeah.
segments.cn: 一般来说，是非法的，是的。

segments.en: It depends on, I guess, you can go to a bookie at the horse races and it's illegal.
segments.cn: 这取决于，我想，你可以在赛马时去找赌徒，这也是非法的。

segments.en: Right, at the horse track.
segments.cn: 对，在赛马场。

segments.en: Yeah, generally, it's illegal, I think.
segments.cn: 是的，一般来说，我认为这是非法的。

segments.en: Okay, so a sports bookie, we would say a sports bookie, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们会说体育赌徒，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Interesting words, a lot of words related to, as we said, addictions and vices, but that's, I guess, kind of what the whole gambling industry involves, right?
segments.cn: 有趣的词，很多与我们所说的上瘾和恶习相关的词，但这，我想，正是整个赌博行业所涉及的，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: All right, so now that we've seen those great words on language takeaway, let's move on now to fluency builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们已经看到了这些关于语言的精彩词汇，让我们现在转到流利度提升。

segments.en: Fluency builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升。

segments.en: Okay, fluency builder is where we get into some of this really exciting stuff, stuff where we hear some opinions from a person who is not very happy with the gambling industry.
segments.cn: 好吧，流利度提升是我们进入一些非常激动人心的内容的地方，听到一个对赌博行业不太满意的人的观点。

segments.en: So, this first one, gambling is an industry built on deception.
segments.cn: 所以，第一个，赌博是一个建立在欺骗上的行业。

segments.en: Okay, so it's built on deception.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以它是建立在欺骗上的。

segments.en: So, well, it's an industry, so it's not really tangible.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一种隐喻。

segments.en: Right, so this is a metaphor.
segments.cn: 就像说这个行业依赖于某种东西。

segments.en: It's like saying that this industry is dependent on something.
segments.cn: 那它依赖于什么？

segments.en: And what is it dependent on?
segments.cn: 欺骗。

segments.en: Deception.
segments.cn: 欺骗。

segments.en: Deception.
segments.cn: 那欺骗是什么？

segments.en: So, what's deception?
segments.cn: 所以，欺骗，对吧？

segments.en: So, to deceive, right?
segments.cn: 这来自动词欺骗，基本上意味着虚假的外表，对吧？

segments.en: That comes from the verb deceive, which basically says like a false appearance, right?
segments.cn: 并不完全真实。

segments.en: Not really being completely truthful.
segments.cn: 好吧，这真的很好。

segments.en: So, a lot of movies that we like to watch or theater is based on deception in a good way, because you get the idea that something is a certain way, but it really isn't in real life.
segments.cn: 所以，我们喜欢看的很多电影或戏剧都是基于欺骗的，好的，因为你会觉得某事是某种方式，但在现实生活中并不是。

segments.en: So, deception in a theater may be a good thing, but in general, deception is a bad thing.
segments.cn: 所以，戏剧中的欺骗可能是好事，但一般来说，欺骗是坏事。

segments.en: I could say, Marco, I'm sorry I deceived you.
segments.cn: 我可以说，马尔科，我很抱歉我欺骗了你。

segments.en: Oh, you lied to me.
segments.cn: 哦，你骗了我。

segments.en: I lied to you, yeah.
segments.cn: 我骗了你，是的。

segments.en: So, deception usually involves lies or trying to make something seem like something that it's not in reality.
segments.cn: 所以，欺骗通常涉及谎言或试图让某事看起来与现实不符。

segments.en: Okay, so it's this industry is built on deception, and he said that the sole purpose of this industry is to make money.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这个行业是建立在欺骗上的，他说这个行业的唯一目的就是赚钱。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确切地说。

segments.en: So, this phrase sole purpose is very, very common.
segments.cn: 所以，这个短语唯一目的非常常见。

segments.en: You hear this a lot.
segments.cn: 你经常听到这个。

segments.en: Sole, like the sole... Like your human soul.
segments.cn: 唯一，像唯一的... 就像你的人类灵魂。

segments.en: Like your human soul.
segments.cn: 就像你的人类灵魂。

segments.en: It's spelled differently.
segments.cn: 拼写不同。

segments.en: S-O-L-E.
segments.cn: S-O-L-E。

segments.en: So, you're talking about the one thing.
segments.cn: 所以，你在谈论一件事。

segments.en: One and only.
segments.cn: 唯一的。

segments.en: Yeah, so my sole love.
segments.cn: 是的，所以我的唯一爱。

segments.en: I only have one love.
segments.cn: 我只有一个爱。

segments.en: My sole pair of shoes.
segments.cn: 我唯一的一双鞋。

segments.en: I only have one pair of shoes, so it's one thing.
segments.cn: 我只有一双鞋，所以这是唯一的事。

segments.en: One.
segments.cn: 一。

segments.en: But the sole purpose, so the only reason that this industry exists is what?
segments.cn: 但唯一目的，所以这个行业存在的唯一原因是什么？

segments.en: For monetary gain.
segments.cn: 为了赚钱。

segments.en: Mmm, so monetary...
segments.cn: 嗯，所以货币...

segments.en: You might have heard of the International Monetary Fund.
segments.cn: 你可能听说过国际货币基金组织。

segments.en: Exactly, the IMF.
segments.cn: 确切地说，IMF。

segments.en: And so monetary refers to money.
segments.cn: 所以货币指的是钱。

segments.en: Money!
segments.cn: 钱！

segments.en: As the door said, it's a gas.
segments.cn: 正如门上所说，这是个好东西。

segments.en: And the gain, which basically means... Making it.
segments.cn: 而收益，基本上意味着... 赚取更多的钱。

segments.en: To get more money.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 所以，这个人所表达的观点是，赌博行业的唯一目的是赚钱。

segments.en: Ouch.
segments.cn: 哎呀。

segments.en: So he's saying, there's no other reason to gamble.
segments.cn: 所以他说，没有其他理由去赌博。

segments.en: People are in this industry just to make money.
segments.cn: 人们在这个行业中只是为了赚钱。

segments.en: It's greedy.
segments.cn: 这是贪婪。

segments.en: Well, I mean, basically you could probably say that almost about all the companies, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，我的意思是，基本上你可能几乎可以这样说，几乎所有公司都是这样，对吧？

segments.en: What about education companies?
segments.cn: 教育公司呢？

segments.en: Like ours?
segments.cn: 像我们这样？

segments.en: That's different, right?
segments.cn: 那是不同的，对吧？

segments.en: Education is very different.
segments.cn: 教育是非常不同的。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对如此。

segments.en: So, what's another industry that has a sole purpose?
segments.cn: 那么，还有哪个行业是有唯一目的的？

segments.en: For example, non-profit organizations.
segments.cn: 比如，非营利组织。

segments.en: Their sole purpose is to help people.
segments.cn: 他们的唯一目的是帮助人们。

segments.en: Alright, okay.
segments.cn: 好吧，好的。

segments.en: I can get into that.
segments.cn: 我可以理解。

segments.en: Yeah, cool.
segments.cn: 是的，酷。

segments.en: So, sole purpose and monetary gain.
segments.cn: 所以，唯一目的和经济利益。

segments.en: Very useful phrases.
segments.cn: 非常有用的短语。

segments.en: But let's take another listen to today's dialogue and put to you some of these great, great new words.
segments.cn: 但让我们再听一遍今天的对话，给你一些这些很棒的新词。

segments.en: Did you hear?
segments.cn: 你听说了吗？

segments.en: The state is thinking of legalizing gambling in our city.
segments.cn: 州政府正在考虑在我们城市合法化赌博。

segments.en: Soon we are going to have amazing hotels and casinos here which will be good for business.
segments.cn: 不久我们将会有很棒的酒店和赌场，这对商业有好处。

segments.en: Are you serious?
segments.cn: 你是认真的吗？

segments.en: Gambling is a vice industry built on deception and fed by the intentional exploitation of human weakness for the sole purpose of monetary gain.
segments.cn: 赌博是一个建立在欺骗基础上的恶习产业，利用人类的弱点以获取经济利益。

segments.en: It disgusts me.
segments.cn: 这让我恶心。

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: How does it exploit people?
segments.cn: 它是如何剥削人们的？

segments.en: Well, to begin with, gambling is addictive.
segments.cn: 首先，赌博是上瘾的。

segments.en: It ruins marriages, destroys families and bankrupts communities.
segments.cn: 它毁掉婚姻，摧毁家庭，使社区破产。

segments.en: Once you're addicted, it's very difficult to stop.
segments.cn: 一旦上瘾，很难停止。

segments.en: People have lost their houses, cars and have been left out on the street after becoming addicted.
segments.cn: 人们失去了房子、汽车，成了街头流浪者。

segments.en: Secondly, it exploits because men become addicted to gambling most often because of the action and risk.
segments.cn: 其次，它的剥削在于，男性往往因为行动和风险而上瘾于赌博。

segments.en: Women gamble to escape and senior citizens will start gambling for social interaction.
segments.cn: 女性赌博是为了逃避，老年人则是为了社交而开始赌博。

segments.en: Underage gamblers often start gambling on sports with friends and then illegal bookies.
segments.cn: 未成年人往往和朋友一起开始赌博，然后找非法庄家。

segments.en: Geez.
segments.cn: 天哪。

segments.en: Now that I think about it, maybe legalizing gambling isn't such a good idea.
segments.cn: 现在想想，也许合法化赌博并不是个好主意。

segments.en: Although, I have been to Las Vegas and I didn't become addicted or anything like that.
segments.cn: 不过，我去过拉斯维加斯，我没有上瘾或其他什么。

segments.en: You cannot predict who will become addicted to gambling.
segments.cn: 你无法预测谁会对赌博上瘾。

segments.en: Now, excuse me.
segments.cn: 现在，失陪一下。

segments.en: I have a protest rally to organize.
segments.cn: 我有一个抗议集会要组织。

segments.en: Alright, so, gambling.
segments.cn: 好吧，那么，赌博。

segments.en: What are your opinions about it?
segments.cn: 你对它有什么看法？

segments.en: Pro-gambling or anti-gambling?
segments.cn: 支持赌博还是反对赌博？

segments.en: Okay, well here's the thing.
segments.cn: 好吧，事情是这样的。

segments.en: Gambling is a sport.
segments.cn: 赌博是一项运动。

segments.en: And it involves money, obviously.
segments.cn: 显然，它涉及金钱。

segments.en: But people also don't... I don't think should have other people telling them how to spend their money unless they have some kind of problem.
segments.cn: 但人们也不... 我认为不应该让其他人告诉他们如何花钱，除非他们有某种问题。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: So the law doesn't get involved if you have a drinking problem until you're harmful to people around you.
segments.cn: 所以法律不会介入，直到你对周围的人造成伤害。

segments.en: So I don't think that it's right for the government to be able to say, listen, you can't gamble.
segments.cn: 所以我认为政府不应该说，听着，你不能赌博。

segments.en: Because it's your own money.
segments.cn: 因为这是你自己的钱。

segments.en: If it makes you happy, it makes you happy.
segments.cn: 如果这让你快乐，那就让你快乐。

segments.en: Interesting.
segments.cn: 有趣。

segments.en: Now, we've seen very specific cities or places where you can actually gamble in this way.
segments.cn: 现在，我们看到了一些特定的城市或地方，你可以以这种方式赌博。

segments.en: So you have Monaco, or Las Vegas, or Macau more recently, right?
segments.cn: 所以你有摩纳哥、拉斯维加斯，或者最近的澳门，对吧？

segments.en: So very interesting cities or countries that have been built on the gambling industry, which apparently is a multi-billion dollar industry.
segments.cn: 所以这些非常有趣的城市或国家是建立在赌博产业上的，而这显然是一个数十亿美元的产业。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对如此。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: What do you think?
segments.cn: 你怎么看？

segments.en: Are you against gambling?
segments.cn: 你反对赌博吗？

segments.en: Are you for gambling?
segments.cn: 你支持赌博吗？

segments.en: I mean, is it one of those things that you can really... Or do you maybe even like it?
segments.cn: 我是说，这是否是你真的可以... 还是你甚至喜欢它？

segments.en: Maybe some people don't even really care for it.
segments.cn: 也许有些人根本不在乎。

segments.en: They don't find it fun to play Blackjack or play a round of poker or something like that.
segments.cn: 他们觉得玩二十一点或玩一轮扑克之类的并不好玩。

segments.en: Yeah, well, that's their problem.
segments.cn: 是的，嗯，那是他们的问题。

segments.en: I enjoy it.
segments.cn: 我喜欢它。

segments.en: I think it's fun.
segments.cn: 我觉得这很有趣。

segments.en: I mean, as long as with anything, you do it in moderation.
segments.cn: 我是说，只要像任何事情一样，你适度地去做。

segments.en: That means you don't do it too much.
segments.cn: 这意味着你不要做得太多。

segments.en: I think it's okay.
segments.cn: 我认为这没问题。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So listeners, come to our website, EnglishPod.com, to the comments section where you can tell us, well, what are your opinions?
segments.cn: 所以听众们，来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，去评论区告诉我们，你的看法是什么？

segments.en: If you do like gambling, tell us what game you like.
segments.cn: 如果你喜欢赌博，告诉我们你喜欢什么游戏。

segments.en: And also, if you have any questions or comments, we're always there to answer them, right?
segments.cn: 还有，如果你有任何问题或评论，我们总是乐意回答，对吧？

segments.en: It can be kind of a big issue to talk about because some people are really against it and some people are really for it.
segments.cn: 这可能是一个很大的话题，因为有些人真的反对它，有些人则支持它。

segments.en: So, curious to hear your opinions.
segments.cn: 所以，期待听到你的看法。

segments.en: Yeah, we look forward to your opinions and we'll see you guys later.
segments.cn: 是的，我们期待你的意见，稍后见。

segments.en: Bye, everyone.
segments.cn: 再见，大家。
